page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area slopes north from a height of 280m towards the rivers Wenning and Hindburn and north west to the flat valley floor of the river Lune.It has a rural,pastoral landscape ranging from moorland on higher ground through rough and improved pasture on the valley bottom.Farming reflects the condition of the pasture with sheep and beef cattle on higher land and dairying pre- dominating on lower slopes and valley floor.Areas unsuitable for farming are forested.There are two hamlets,Farleton and Claughton and a small industrial area west of Claughton by the A683.The A683 Kirby Lonsdale/Lancaster road follows the foot of the Lune valley side.The B6480 branches to the east at the foot of the Wenning valley.Two minor roads to farmsteads climb the valley side.
